hints_html:
Try L’Hopital’s rule.

Failing L’Hopital’s rule (or if you don’t know it) one can also use Taylor polynomials.
hints_latex:
Failing L'Hopital's rule (or if you don't know it) one can also use
Taylor polynomials.
hints_raw:
Try L'Hopital's rule.
Failing L'Hopital's rule (or if you don't know it) one can also use Taylor polynomials.
question: 4 (b)
sols_html:
Plugging in \(x=0\) in the limit gives an indeterminant form \(0/0\) and so we may attempt to use L’Hopital’s rule to get

\(\lim_{x \to 0}\frac{e^{3x^{2}}-1}{\sin(x^{2})} = \lim_{x \to 0}\frac{6xe^{3x^{2}}}{2x\cos(x^{2})}= \lim_{x \to 0}\frac{3e^{3x^{2}}}{\cos(x^{2})} = \frac{3e^{0}}{1}=3\)

Using Taylor Polynomials we get

\[\begin{aligned} \lim_{x \to 0}\frac{e^{3x^{2}}-1}{\sin(x^{2})} &= \lim_{x \to 0}\frac{(1 + (3x^{2})^1/1 + (3x^{2})^{2}/2 + ...)-1}{x^{2} - x^{6}/3 + ...}\\ &= \lim_{x \to 0}\frac{3x^{2} + (3x^{2})^{2}/2 + ...}{x^{2} - x^{6}/3 + ...}\\ &= \lim_{x \to 0}\frac{3 + 9x^{2}/2 + ...}{1 - x^{4}/3 + ...} \\ &= 3\end{aligned}\]
sols_latex:
Plugging in $x=0$ in the limit gives an indeterminant form $0/0$ and so
we may attempt to use L'Hopital's rule to get

$\lim_{x \to 0}\frac{e^{3x^{2}}-1}{\sin(x^{2})} = \lim_{x \to 0}\frac{6xe^{3x^{2}}}{2x\cos(x^{2})}= \lim_{x \to 0}\frac{3e^{3x^{2}}}{\cos(x^{2})} = \frac{3e^{0}}{1}=3$
sols_raw:
Plugging in <math>x=0</math> in the limit gives an indeterminant form <math>0/0</math> and so we may attempt to use L'Hopital's rule to get

<math>
\lim_{x \to 0}\frac{e^{3x^{2}}-1}{\sin(x^{2})} = \lim_{x \to 0}\frac{6xe^{3x^{2}}}{2x\cos(x^{2})}= \lim_{x \to 0}\frac{3e^{3x^{2}}}{\cos(x^{2})} = \frac{3e^{0}}{1}=3
</math>
Using Taylor Polynomials we get

:<math>
\begin{align}
\lim_{x \to 0}\frac{e^{3x^{2}}-1}{\sin(x^{2})} &= \lim_{x \to 0}\frac{(1 + (3x^{2})^1/1 + (3x^{2})^{2}/2 + ...)-1}{x^{2} - x^{6}/3 + ...}\\
&=  \lim_{x \to 0}\frac{3x^{2} + (3x^{2})^{2}/2 + ...}{x^{2} - x^{6}/3 + ...}\\
&=  \lim_{x \to 0}\frac{3 + 9x^{2}/2 + ...}{1 - x^{4}/3 + ...} \\
&= 3
\end{align}
</math>
statement_html:

\(\lim_{x \to 0}\frac{e^{3x^{2}}-1}{\sin(x^{2})}\)
